main.name: Evan Feder
main.description: Hey! I'm a student at Carnegie Mellon University, studying Information Systems, Statistics, and Machine Learning. I'm interested in exploring the world of software engineering and data science with applications across finance, tech, and a variety of industries. I'm also the Student Body President of Carnegie Mellon, working to make student voices heard on campus through student government initiatives.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Information Systems, additional major in Statistics and Machine Learning

work.title: Software Engingeering Intern
work.description: Enhanced full stack web application for medical fraud detection written in Javascript using React, Node.js, and Express with an Elasticsearch database and an end-to-end Cucumber testing suite. Saved fraud investigators several hours per week of work after pushing enhancements into production.

work.title: Data Science Intern
work.description: Developed and implemented pipeline using Python and SQL to collect, compile, clean, and feature-engineer 100,000+ lines of training data. Analyzed football play formation data and presented findings to the Miami Dolphins' head coach, which was then used in choosing Dolphins' plays during the 2018 NFL season.

work.title: Summer Analyst
work.description: Collaborated on a team project to determine the effect of New York’s Excelsior Scholarship program on the financing of small, private colleges which was published in the firm’s Weekly Outlook. Analyzed the Electronic Municipal Market Access database, compiling three years of municipal bond default data for use in firm’s investment research.

work.title: Vice President
work.description: Managed student-run tutoring organization with more than 40 tutors and 150 clients. Grew revenues by over 50% to more than $80,000 annually. Personally tutored middle and high school students for over 300 hours in math, physics, chemistry, SAT/ACT preparation, and other subjects.

testimonials.text: Check out CMU student government at https://www.cmu.edu/stugov/index.html. This section is a work in progress.
